In childhood I was curious, active and very mobile, expressed opinions and insisted on my wishes
In adolescence I was competitive and determined and was a member of sports teams
I'm an independent person and don't want to depend on others to fulfill my needs
I'm strongly opposed to injustice and discrimination and fight against it
I have a quick and reactive temperament and rarely fall short, especially in relationship with men
I stand by my word and what I want to do and insist, and usually don't give in, and because of this characteristic, others often see me as self-willed, stubborn and hard-headed
I'm interested in wearing comfortable and sporty clothes and shoes, and it's important to me to be comfortable in what I wear to have high speed of action
I'm a competitive person (even sometimes I have competitive feeling toward my spouse!)
I'm serious but not arrogant and down-to-earth, though some see me as harsh
I say my opinions frankly, directly and openly, even if others get upset
I have strong moral and belief principles, always take them seriously and fight for them
I'm athletic and interested in sports like mountaineering, long-distance running, cycling, basketball, archery, horseback riding, tennis and skiing, and like my body to be in shape and fit
My motto in life is: I can handle my own work myself
Coquetry and charm of women seem low-value and unnecessary to me, and I don't like a man to have a sexual view of me

I'm a supporter of women's rights and am present in gatherings supporting women's rights, because society is full of women under pressure and oppression from men or unfair laws, and I always do whatever I can for them to get their rights from men and save them
I despise women who show weakness toward men - I prefer women who compete with men and win and show that women lack nothing compared to men and may even be stronger and better
At the same time I support the weak and suffering, but generally I don't like weak people
Independence and not depending on men is very important to me
After marriage it's important to me to use my own family name
If I'm married, I still feel single and not dependent on my spouse from within
In married life I seek equality of rights between myself and my spouse
Sexual relationship is not my priority but sometimes it's like a pleasant physical activity for me
I've raised my children to be independent and self-sufficient
I'm interested in living in pristine nature rather than modern city
My deep inner satisfaction comes when no one interferes in my life and I'm not limited and personally make decisions for myself and have adventures
